newsitem.title: FINLAND: ETLA SEES FINNISH KEY RATE ON HOLD UNTIL PAY DEAL.
newsitem.headline: ETLA SEES FINNISH KEY RATE ON HOLD UNTIL PAY DEAL.

text.p: Finnish monetary policy is likely to remain on hold until the impact of next year's pay deal -- and of potential related income tax breaks -- is known, a Finnish think-tank said in a report received on Tuesday.

"Last time the Bank of Finland raised interest rates before the beginning of the wage round," the Research Institute of the Finnish Economy (ETLA) said, referring to the summer of 1995 when the central bank last raised its key tender rate.
"This time the central bank is expected to take a wait-and-see attitude until the terms of the wage settlement and possible tax changes are known," it said.
"The tightness of monetary policy in Finland next year will hinge upon this autumn's wage settlement and inflation outlook for the next few years," ETLA added.
Unions and employers are scheduled in the coming autumn to negotiate wages for a deal from February 1998 onward.

The government has said it may contribute to boost workers' real earnings by introducing further income tax breaks in exchange for non-inflationary low nominal pay rises. --Helsinki newsroom +358-9-680 50 245, e-mail news@reuters.fi
